cff-version: 1.2.0
message: "If you use this software, please cite it as below."
authors:
- family-names: "Goel"
  given-names: "Rajat"
  orcid: "https://orcid.org/0000-0002-8051-9798"
title: "Contextual Spell Check"
version: 0.4.1
doi: 10.5281/zenodo.4642379
date-released: 2021-03-1
url: "https://github.com/R1j1t/contextualSpellCheck"

description.excerpt:
It is essential to understand that identifying whether a candidate is a spelling error is a big task. 
Spelling errors are broadly classified as non- word errors (NWE) and real word errors (RWE). If the misspelt string is a valid word in the language, then it is called an RWE, else it is an NWE.

This package currently focuses on Out of Vocabulary (OOV) word or non-word error (NWE) correction using BERT model. The idea of using BERT was to use the context when correcting OOV. To improve this package, I would like to extend the functionality to identify RWE, optimising the package, and improving the documentation.

To make the usage easy, contextual spellchecker provides custom spacy extensions which your code can consume. This makes it easier for the user to get the desired data. contextualSpellCheck provides extensions on the doc, span and token level. Below tables summaries the extensions.

| doc..performed_spellCheck | Boolean | To check whether contextualSpellCheck identified any misspells and performed correction | False | 
| doc..suggestions_spellCheck | {Spacy.Token:str} | if corrections are performed, it returns the mapping of misspell token (spaCy.Token) with suggested word(str) | {} |

| doc._.score_spellCheck | {Spacy.Token:List(str,float)} | if corrections are identified, it returns the mapping of misspell token (spaCy.Token) with suggested words(str) and probability of that correction | None |

| span..get_has_spellCheck | Boolean | To check whether contextualSpellCheck identified any misspells and performed correction in this span | False | 
| span..score_spellCheck | {Spacy.Token:List(str,float)} | if corrections are identified, it returns the mapping of misspell token (spaCy.Token) with suggested words(str) and probability of that correction for tokens in this span | {spaCy.Token: []} |
| token..get_require_spellCheck | Boolean | To check whether contextualSpellCheck identified any misspells and performed correction on this token | False |

| token._.score_spellCheck | [(str,float)] | if corrections are identified, it returns suggested words(str) and probability(float) of that correction | [] | 
At present, there is a simple GET API to get you started. You can run the app in your local and play with it.
[ ] use cython for part of the code to improve performance (#39)
[ ] Update the logic of misspell identification (OOV) (#44)
[ ] add metric by testing on datasets
- [x] allow user to specify bert model

installation.excerpt:
The package can be installed using [pip](https://pypi.org/project/contextualSpellCheck/). You would require python 3.6+

```bash
pip install contextualSpellCheck
```
Or you can add to spaCy pipeline manually!
: You can pass the optional parameters to the contextualSpellCheck
Query: You can use the endpoint http://127.0.0.1:5000/?query=YOUR-QUERY

invocation.excerpt: | doc..outcome_spellCheck | str | corrected sentence(str) as output | "" |

excerpt.body:
`torch` was removed from the `setup.py` which caused issue for users who did not have torch installed (#55).  
PR #56 fixed this issue

Thanks @Tocic for pointing it out.
excerpt.name: fixed dependency in package

excerpt.body:
This release adds support to spaCy v3! 

Check [Usage](https://github.com/R1j1t/contextualSpellCheck#usage) to understand the changes in contextualSpellCheck.
To read about spaCy v3 changes: https://spacy.io/usage/v3 

Fixes issue #48 

A big thanks to @jonmun for the PR #49!!
excerpt.name: Supporting spaCy v3

excerpt.body:
bug fix #48 
Documentation changes:
- Bibliography update 
- issue number added in task list 
- minor changes to issue template
excerpt.name: bug fix & minor documentation updates

excerpt.body:
This release fixes bug(#30). Extra changes:
- setup staleBot
- converted TODO task to issues
- setup discussions

Thanks @nicno90 for raising the bug!
excerpt.name: fix bug

excerpt.body:
This release 
- fixes #26. 
- improved the code quality by enforcing style consistency (#23). 

Thanks @dc-aichara for the PR on flake8 and thanks @nicno90 for pointing out a bug in the package!

Note: Had to yank release v0.3.1 because of debug print statement in production package.
excerpt.name: bug fix & code quality improvement

excerpt.body:
This release adds following important changes:
1. Feature addition: Specifying the transformer model
This will enable the package to be **used on other languages** as well for which `transformers` has a model
2. Feature addition: specify the maximum edit distance
3. Update: Vocab loading now happens from the transformers tokenizer. Previously it used a static file (vocab.txt)

A big thanks to @dc-aichara for **contributing Feature addition 1 and 2**.
excerpt.name: Specify transformer model

excerpt.body: This release specify the core dependency of the project in the setup. This was suggested (#17) and added by @AlvaroCavalcante in #18.
excerpt.name: Dependency added to setup

excerpt.body:
Following changes in this release:
1. Allow user specified vocab to identify misspell (#12)
2. Fix a bug where file read presented issue. Thanks to @gaurav0804 for #11
excerpt.name: Allow user specific vocab and minor fix

excerpt.body:
Thanks @mark-fangzhou-xie for pointing out an issue where the token text and position is modified an a downstream process. This affected our custom extension.  

As a fix
- use setter for corrected sentence and not getter (to solve issue with downstream process)
- raise warning when extension is accessed and the token position/text is modified
excerpt.name: Fix: token modification by package downstream

excerpt.body:
Updated following:

1. Context changed from `Doc` to `Span` (sentence) in `candidateGenerator` hence `parser` is required
2. `doc._.outcome_spellCheck` extension will now be a getter
3. `doc._.suggestions_spellCheck` is now set during the call to `candidateRanking` and outputs our recommendation 
4. Updated `suggestions_spellCheck` response from `{spaCy.Token: List(str)}` to `{spaCy.Token: str}` as `score_spellcheck` extension was also giving similar data
5. `misspellIdentify` updated with new conditions

Some other minors enhancements and fixes!  

Thanks all, who downloaded and tried the package, please ⭑ the repo if you like the work!
excerpt.name: Release with better doc and extension

excerpt.body: This is first release of the package. There is still many tasks left from here!
excerpt.name: Initial public release

support.excerpt: If you like the project, please ⭑ the project and show your support! Also, if you feel, the current behaviour is not as expected, please feel free to raise an [issue](https://github.com/R1j1t/contextualSpellCheck/issues). If you can help with any of the above tasks, please open a [PR](https://github.com/R1j1t/contextualSpellCheck/pulls) with necessary changes to documentation and tests.

usage.excerpt: **Note:** For use in other languages check [`examples`](https://github.com/R1j1t/contextualSpellCheck/tree/master/examples) folder.
